column4: this isnt' totally related, but I keep running out of space on my ubuntu installation. Where are all the things i can delete? ( similar to windows' ttemp and temp internet files?)
you can go through synaptic removing installs you don't need, and you can run filelight to find where all your space has gone
so there aren't any places like in windows where linux keeps "trash" like "temp" and "temporary internet files" ?
/tmp - but a lot of what you see in there is being used - well behaved apps will clean tmp files on exit, also /tmp is emptied on reboot
